title: Ti-Anna Wang
text:
Ti-Anna Wang (born 1989) is a Chinese-Canadian-American dissident and daughter of <a href="Wang%20Bingzhang%20%28dissident%29">Wang Bingzhang</a>. Her father is currently imprisoned in China for political agitation.
Life.
She grew up in <a href="Montreal">Montreal</a>.
In 2008, she lobbied for the release of her father.
<a href="Fred%20Hiatt">Fred Hiatt</a> wrote a fictional account of her efforts to free her father.
On January 9, 2019, she was denied entry to China while trying to visit her father. Despite possessing a valid visa she was deported to <a href="Jeju%20Island">Jeju Island, South Korea</a>. On January 16 she took a return flight from <a href="Seoul">Seoul</a> to <a href="Toronto">Toronto</a> that connected through Beijing. When the plane landed in <a href="Beijing">Beijing</a>, she was detained by police and sent back to South Korea.
